name: linux-gravatar
tagline: Set your Linux profile picture using gravatar
body:
linux-gravatar ============== --- [![Build Status](https://travis-ci.org/jrosco/linux-gravatar.svg?branch=master)](https://travis-ci.org/jrosco/linux-gravatar) Intro ----- Set your Linux profile picture using gravatar. *Version Alpha 0.1.1* **N.B: Only tested on Mint 17 and Ubuntu 14.04** Build/Install/Setup/Run ----- **Clone git repo:** git clone https://github.com/jrosco/linux-gravatar.git **Change directory and run setup:** cd linux-gravatar; sudo python setup.py install **Run application:** /usr/bin/linux-gravatar **Setup your settings:** * Click on the linux-gravatar trayicon ![(img_logo)](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/jrosco/linux-gravatar/master/gui/gravatar.png) * Enter your email address used to grab the avatar and set the check time (number of minutes between scans) * Select Apply **Setting values explained:** The settings file can be found in your home directory ~/.gravatar_settings.cfg 
email = "The email address used to get your avatar"

check = "The amount of time in seconds to scrape the gravatar url for your avatar"

startup = "Not currently used"
**N.B: You need to run the application first before apply the settings, as the application creates the settings file after it is ran.**
